text: The magua ( Manchu: olbo) was a style of jacket worn by males during the Chinese Qing dynasty (1644â€“1911). It was designed to be worn together with the manshi changshan (). It was worn by Manchu people throughout China from the reign of the Qing Shunzhi Emperor (r. 1643-1661) until the time of the Kangxi Emperor, (r. 1661-1722). ==References== Category:Tops (clothing)
title: Magua (clothing)
